gen:ReportedAttribute.com:Text: Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.6 Build effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels
16.6.1. Level of confidence of the population in the main state institutions (Parliament, Government, Justice)
NDAYISENGA Modest
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
ESSSP department manager
1157 BUJUMBURA
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
This is the percentage of the population whose last experience with public services was satisfactory
Household surveys
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.

This indicator is relevant because it highlights the difference between the crude birth rate and the crude death rate. It measures the increase of a population over a period of time due only to births and deaths
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
Ratio of the population whose last experience with public services was satisfactory to the total population, expressed as a percentage
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
Available nationally
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
EICVMB Household Survey Report 2019_2020

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.9 By 2030, ensure legal identity for all, including through birth registration
16.9.1 Proportion of children under 5 with a birth certificate
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
ESSSP department manager
1157 BUJUMBURA
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
This is the percentage of children under 5 with a birth certificate
Household surveys
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
5 years
5 years
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is responsible for compiling this indicator at the national level
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
This indicator is relevant because it highlights the proportion of people victims of violence during a year.
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
Ratio of children under 5 with a birth certificate to the total of children under 5, expressed as a percentage
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
The indicator is available at national level, province, Place of residence (National; Girls; Boys; Urban area; Rural area)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Household Surveys Report

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.1 Significantly reduce all forms of violence and associated death rates everywhere
16.1.1. Percentage of people who have been victims of gender-based violence
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
Social studies and statistics and poverty monitoring (ESSSP)
ESSSP department manager
1158 BUJUMBURA
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
Percentage of people who have been victims of gender-based violence
Percentage
Household surveys
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021 (Next DHS)
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is the body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
This indicator is relevant because it highlights the percentage of women who have been victims of gender-based violence.
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
Ratio of people who have been victims of gender-based violence to the total population, expressed as a percentage
The results of the survey are validated at two levels: technical validation and official validation before publication
Available by gender and Place of residence (Women; Men; Urban; Rural)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
EDSB II Household Survey Report 2016_2017

Available by gender and Place of residence (Women; Men; Urban; Rural)

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.1 Significantly reduce all forms of violence and associated death rates everywhere
16.1.3 Proportion of the population likely to be the victim of criminal violence in the last 12 months
ISTEEBU
NDAYISENGA Modest
ESSSP department manager
ndayimode2010@gmail.com
This is the percentage of the population at risk of being a victim of criminal violence in the past 12 months
Household surveys
Data are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaire
The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is the central body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects safety
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
Ratio of the population likely to be the victim of criminal violence in the past 12 months and the total population, expressed as a percentage
Validation is done at national level
Available at national level, gender and Place of residence (National; Male; Female; Urban; Rural)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Report of the Survey on Household Living Conditions in Burundi 2013

This is the percentage of the population considering that there is no danger in walking alone in their area of residence during the day.
Household surveys

The probable date of the next collection will be 2021
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU
ISTEEBU is the central body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.
The indicator is relevant because it reflects safety
Updating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.
Ratio between the population considering that there is no danger in walking alone in their area of residence and the total population, expressed as a percentage
Validation is done at national level
Available at national level, gender and Place of residence (National; Male; Female; Urban; Rural)
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Report of the Survey on Household Living Conditions in Burundi 2013

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.3 Promote the rule of law in domestic and international order and guarantee equal access to justice for all
16.3.2. Proportion of judicial backlogs in the different jurisdictions
Ministry of Justice, Civil Protection and Keeper of the Seals
GAHIMBARE Nicodemus
Statistical service
SDG focal point within the Ministry
gahidemu@yahoo.fr

This is the percentage of cases before all the jurisdictions of Burundi, except the Courts of Residence, which have not yet found a decision on the merits before these courts in which they are found in relation to all the cases enrolled during the period considered
Administrative data
Data is collected from administrative files
Annual
Annual
MJPCGS
MJPCGS
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
This indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of performance of the justice system
The update of this indicator depends on the regular collection of data from the domain

Report between the cases before all the jurisdictions of Burundi, except the Courts of Residence, which have not yet found a decision on the merits before these courts in which they are found and all the cases enrolled during the period under consideration, expressed percentage
Validation is done at two levels: internal level and at CTIS level before publication
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Statistical yearbook of the Ministry

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.3 Promote the rule of law in domestic and international order and guarantee equal access to justice for all
16.3.1. Percentage of magistrates recruited following a competitive examination
Ministry of Justice, Civil Protection and Keeper of the Seals
GAHIMBARE Nicodemus
Statistical service
SDG focal point within the Ministry
gahidemu@yahoo.fr
This is the proportion of magistrates recruited from a competitive examination
Administrative data
Data is collected from administrative files
Annual
Annual
MJPCGS
MJPCGS
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
This indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of performance of the justice system
The update of this indicator depends on the regular collection of data from the domain
Ratio between magistrates recruited from a competitive examination and all magistrates, expressed as a percentage
Validation is done at two levels: internal level and at CTIS level before publication
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Statistical yearbook of the Ministry

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.5. Significantly reduce corruption and the practice of bribes in all their forms

Statistical service
SDG focal point within the Ministry
gahidemu@yahoo.fr

Number
Administrative data
Data is collected from administrative files
Annual
Annual
MJPCGS
MJPCGS
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
This indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of performance of the justice system
The update of this indicator depends on the regular collection of data from the domain
Periodic survey of corruption cases registered in the judicial services
Validation is done at two levels: internal level and at CTIS level before publication

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.5. Significantly reduce corruption and the practice of bribes in all their forms
16.5.2. Percentage of corruption cases tried by the Anti-Corruption Court
Ministry of Justice, Civil Protection and Keeper of the Seals
GAHIMBARE Nicodemus
Statistical service
SDG focal point within the Ministry
gahidemu@yahoo.fr
This is the percentage of cases judged by the Anti-Corruption Court compared to all cases in progress in a given year
Administrative data
Data is collected from administrative files
Annual
Annual
MJPCGS
MJPCGS
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
This indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of performance of the justice system
The update of this indicator depends on the regular collection of data from the domain
Ratio between the cases judged by the judicial services and cases registered during a given period
Validation is done at two levels: internal level and at CTIS level before publication
The indicator is available at national level
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Statistical yearbook of the Ministry

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.b Promote and enforce non-discriminatory laws and policies for sustainable development
16.b.1 Proportion of the population who reported having personally experienced discrimination or harassment in the previous 12 months on grounds prohibited by international human rights law
category III
Category III

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions

category III

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions
16.4 By 2030, significantly reduce illicit financial flows and arms trafficking, step up recovery and return activities for stolen property and fight all forms of organized crime
16.4.2 Number of weapons seized, found or surrendered voluntarily, the origin or illicit use of which has been traced or established by the competent authorities
MDNAC & MSPGC
This is the number of weapons by type seized
Number
Administrative data
Data is collected from administrative files
Annual
Annual
MJPCGS
MJPCGS & MDNAC
The Ministerial departments are the members of the SSN whose mission is to collect, process and disseminate the data of their sector.
This indicator is relevant because it reflects the level of performance of the justice system
The update of this indicator depends on the regular collection of data from the domain
Count of weapons seized by type
Validation is done at two levels: internal level and at CTIS level before publication
Available nationally and by weapon type ([MDNAC: Weapons, Grenades, Cartridges, Bombs]; [MSPGC: Weapons, Grnades, Cartridges, Bombs])
The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international level
Statistical yearbook of the Ministry

Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions

16.a Support, particularly within the framework of international cooperation, the national institutions responsible for strengthening, at all levels, the means of preventing violence and combating terrorism and crime, in particular in developing countries
16.a.1 Existence of independent national human rights institutions in accordance with the Paris Principles
